page.title: 18Trade
page.content: The old flour mill buildings are now in use at Shepherds Yeat for making oak palings for sale to local farmers, garden centres and at the agricultural shows in Lakeland, two farms are now at the stage of producing vegetables and salad crops for sale to the wholesale market in Windermere, which is now expanding. This is a very new industrial project which may develop. The Cheales family in Winster are making small animals, such as voles, squirrels and field mice, sculptured in cotton wool and painted exquisitely in the natural colours. A window with a display of these in Windermere town is at present collecting orders and also inviting enquiries from the trade.
